Description:

The Advisory Aces is a structured 2 year rotational programme for selected high achieving Graduates
column2: spanning a broad overview of the Advisory division. They will undergo selected rotations within selected departments
column3: subject to the Firm’s discretion in consideration of project requirements. For Accounting and Finance candidates
column4: they will undergo a rotation in Audit as well. Upon completion
column5: the candidate will be placed in a suitable department upon review of their performance in all rotations throughout the programme subject to the Firm’s discretion.

column1:
Responsibilities:

As part of each rotation:

  • Participate in project delivery as a team member.
  • Support project manager or work-stream leader to achieve project KPIs
column2:
undertake project filing and maintain the quality of the project.
  • Business report writing and preparation of presentation slides.
  • Support the Business Development team in proposal writing
column3:
research and development of sales presentation slides and kits.
  • Undertake research and analysis to support project requirements and practice development.
Technology
column7:
Finance or Economics
  • 1st Class Honours or CGPA 3.5 and above
  • Excellent leadership qualities
  • Enjoy working in teams
  • Active involvement in co-curricular activities

The Senior Associate will assists the Accounting team in daily deliverables to ensure excellent service to clients.

and other tailor made management reports/ financial analysis.

ROLE POSITIONING AND OBJECTIVES

timely execution and in compliance with accounting principles and agreed SLAs.

Description:

Looking forward to a data-driven career in a dynamic environment? KPMG is now on the lookout for young talents to join the Lighthouse Centre of Excellence’s Project Management Team.

This role exists to independently manage small-scale data-driven projects (and assist on medium/large-scale projects) from the end-to-end project lifecycle. This role will bring exposure to both external & internal projects across solutions such as Business Intelligence
column3: Software & Application and Intelligent Automation.

column1: You will be working closely with a wide range of business and technology professionals to ensure projects are delivered on time and with quality.

Inspire Confidence. Empower Change.

KPMG the Clear Choice.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage end-to-end project activities from requirement gathering to deployment phase to ensure that projects are delivered on-time and achieves the final project objectives
  • Escalate project risk and stay in constant status communication with relevant stakeholders (external & internal)
  • Superior follow-up skills to ensure that actions are completed
column2:
and issues are resolved in a timely manner
  • Track and monitor project progress/status
column3:
prepare project status slides and lead internal project alignment meetings
  • Prepare documents such as User Requirement Specification (URS) documents
column4:
User Acceptance Testing (UAT) test cases
  • Perform internal testing of the solutions developed
  • Ensuring proper documentation and filling of final deliverables
  • Assist with the preparation of project planning and timeline requirements for new proposals
  • Translate technical requirements/jargons to business users

column1: Encouraged to equip yourself with different types of skillsets by exploring other areas of work within Lighthouse such as Data Analytics
column3: Intelligent Automation

The Accounts Payable Officer will be responsible for ensuring the timely and accurate processing of supplier invoices and settlement of accounts by agreed payment terms. A core focus is providing a high level of customer service to internal and external stakeholders and providing streamlined accurate processing of transactions through the AP system. Continuous improvement towards improving efficiency in the AP process and development and alignment of the Shared Services team is also a core focus of the role. Adhere to Procure to Pay Management services required to support and sustain the day-to-day business.

Key Task in the Role:

  • Process invoices accurately
column3: by Company policy
column4:
and complying with accounting standards.
  • Ensure accurate and timely coding of invoices
  • Review all invoices for appropriate documentation and approval before payment
  • Ensure Delegation of Authorities (“DoA”) is adhered to.
  • Process 3-way PO matching invoices
  • Correct indexing of documents in the system (Doclink) with accurate status
  • Ensure that all credit notes are reviewed
column6:
and processed accurately and promptly.
  • Be responsible for the reconciliation of vendor statements to ensure that all aged items are addressed and followed through to resolution.
  • Prepare vendor payment batches as required to meet payment terms and maximize Delivered At Place (“DAP”)
  • Monthly review of Aged Payables and clear/tidy up outstanding transactions every quarter.
  • Ensure all new vendors and modified existing vendors are verified through the system
  • (EFTsure)
  • Provide ad-hoc support to improve the service level provided to the business
  • Identify improvements to the accounts payable process and actively participate in the process improvement initiatives
  • Other ad hoc duties associated with assisting the finance team
  • Assist with internal and external audit queries and requests
  • Managing supplier and internal inquiries
  • Responding to queries in a courteous and timely manner.
  • Meet and aim to exceed stakeholder expectations.
  • Be flexible and able to adapt to the needs of the evolving AP functions.
  • Maintain files and archived documents thoroughly and accurately
column7: by company policy and accepted accounting practices

operational and system control procedures

column1:
About the Role

This is an opportunity for an experienced Senior Accountant to join a rapidly developing and constantly growing cutting-edge technology based business. Dyson is expanding and is looking for experienced staff to take Dyson through its next stage of growth.

• You will report to an Lead Accountant.
  • Support the Lead Accountant (your line manager) on month end close process;
  • Statutory filing requirements including but not limited to Annual Financial Statements
column2:
liaising with the auditors and Group finance team
  • Preparation and submission of regulatory bodies reports
  • Financial control and governance including legal and secretarial compliance.
  • Presenting and reviewing monthly financial statements and performance with Site Controller / Finance Director
  • Lead/support on specific tasks and projects. You will also work with the other operations finance teams across different Dyson sites.
  • You will proactively and continuously challenge and improve everything you encounter.
  • Ad hoc analysis of business as required

  • Analytical and problem-solving mindset to tackle daily operations issues from multiple angles

  • Inherent ability to plan and deliver systematic improvements to financial and business processes.
  • Strong team player and naturally collaborative in approach to develop strong
column2:

column1: If you love the business side of information security this is the place to be. Within the CISO pillar we work closely with member firm stakeholders to understand their business model and roadmap for technology. In turn CISO pillar delivers the roadmap for Network Information Security and drives engagement and adoption of our central security services in line with the PwC Cyber Readiness program. Management of relationships between NIS and the business is key to delivering the cyber readiness mission. Whether it be integrating solutions
column2: driving operational processes or providing guidance back to NIS to further enhance our strategy
column3: CISO pillar provides the engagement and personal touch to enable NIS to deliver maximum value to the customer

column2: you will be involved from the outset in an exciting new opportunity
column3: working with other PwC firms in the delivery of security services and management of cyber security risk. You will be working constantly with those in other timezones each and every day
column4: so you need to be comfortable and experienced in fitting this around your workday.

• Engage with business stakeholders to assess security threats/vulnerabilities and manage business risk;

other PwC firms and Network Information Security;
  • Govern lines of service for compliance with PwC’s Information Security Policy (ISP) and legal/regulatory frameworks;

column1: Kerry is the world's leading taste and nutrition company for the food
column2: beverage and pharmaceutical industries. Every day we partner with customers to create healthier
column3: tastier and more sustainable products that are consumed by billions of people across the world. Our vision is to be our customers' most valued partner
column4: creating a world of sustainable nutrition. A career with Kerry offers you an opportunity to shape the future of food while providing you opportunities to explore and grow in a truly global environment.

column1: As a Plant Accountant/ Senior Accountant you will report to the Integrated Operations Finance Lead. The Plant Accountant will have 2 main roles : (1) 50% of his time will play a pivotal role in supporting Kerry Shah Alam's Finance function to deliver timely and accurate financial information
column3: to key stakeholders; (2) another 50% of his time is to support the SAP IO Finance on cross-functional initiatives
column4: IO PMO and acquisition integration projects as required.

column1: The Plant Accountant will assume key responsibility for supporting the IO leadership team through financial analyses
column3: cost accounting and insights on reporting packages for the Plant leadership teams. As a member of the Senior Management Team of Kerry Shah Alam’s plant
column4: you will be responsible for the generation of a cross organizational budgeting & forecasting process
column5: which will produce robust & reliable financial plans to support IO and business strategic business plans.

column2: processes and systems are implemented across Kerry's manufacturing facilities
column3: the Plant Accountant is expected to be a strong Agent of Change and Kerry champion while balancing a strong commercial growth agenda.

column1: The successful candidate will also be expected to support cross-functional initiatives
column2: IO PMO and acquisition integration projects as required. This position is a flexing role most suited to a commercially astute and ambitious person who is naturally comfortable working autonomously and acting with a high degree of stakeholder engagement and buy-in. The successful candidate will be a strong team player
column3: capable of demonstrating key leadership competencies and working in a fast paced and dynamic environment.

column1: Managing Financials– Responsible for the accuracy of all plant financials including production volume
column3: material usage variance
column4: and standard costs. A clear understanding of inventory and the controls process are key

column3: variance analysis
column4: and commentary that leads to an understanding of the IO performance
column5: enabling improved decision making and identification of opportunities

column1: Planning– Lead the forecast and budget process with plant IO stakeholders. Support the forecast process driven by S&OP update on monthly or needed basis

Capital Management– Site Capital Gatekeeper partnering with the Plant Manager & Engineering Team. Partner with and coach the Plant Leadership Team in ensuring compliance to CAPEX Approval requirements
column2: including data gathering to develop business plans
column3: insights to influence decision making
column4: ensuring forward looking plans to mitigate against Food Safety and Machine Breakdowns.

column3: associated phasing and review with the Plant Team to ensure projects are delivered within the approved budgets and agreed timeline.

column1: Accelerate & Other Projects – Identifies areas of opportunity in the business associated with continuous improvement in areas of financial performance
column3: processes
column5: systems and other areas. Financial Insights on the project plans and actual performance v targets.

column1: Continuous Improvement Programme - Participate in the assessment and validation of Plant Performance Programs & Scenario Planning and financial assumptions. Specify plant strategic investment requirements
column3: work with SME’s to validate projects
column4: payback and quantitative and qualitative KPI

column1: Inventory control - Gatekeeper for inventory at site and at 3PL’s – including stocktake and inventory valuation is aligned to Kerry’s and Inventory Policy. Consult
column2: partner with Supply Chain to ensure Inventory IDOS adherence and SAR is minimised with aligned cross functional push strategies to minimize Kerry’s write off exposure. Engage closely with Supply Chain on inventory holding strategy to achieve the Inventory Holding & IDOS target and minimise inventory at risk.

column1: IO PMO – provide project management support for Integrated Office projects and Site Leadership team. This support includes but is not limited to scope definition
column3: status reporting & tracking
column4: and risk management. In conjunction with the Plant Leadership Team drive results to ensure on time deployment of the project with the Plant and highlight when and what support is needed if issues arise whilst managing risks and removing blockages that might impact delivery.

column1: EPM - Collaborate with the Functional Leads to ensure EPM data is reliable and support Plant Leadership team in understanding EPM Metrics. Leverage KPI’s in EPM to influence Plant Performance and lead with data insights to align across functions
Financial compliance risk - Deployment of a site Governance model to ensure compliance with site KCSA
column2: internal and Group policies ensure compliance. Ensure site compliance in line with KCSA governance

column1: Product Costing & Valuation (Material Ledger) - Ensure connectivity and timelines with the GBS to ensure Material Ledger is closed in accordance with regional timelines and is accurate and complete

column2: labour and direct overhead standards reflect the true cost of manufacture. Working with the Plant
column3: Business and Process Teams to resolve any differences

column1: Strategic business partner for the Site Leadership Team.

5 - 8 years of experience in accounting and/or financial analysis
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel is required; familiarity with data query/data management tools extremely helpful (Microsoft Word

column1: Strong project management skills essential with broad understanding of functional workings of each department within a standalone business

column1: Central Testing Excellence Team is composed of approximately 50 FTE of senior and junior analysts across all 4 centers. The Controls Assurance Sr Analyst supports CTE Manager in creating a risk based financial control testing plan for majority of RDS Group financial controls operated by Finance Operations as well as in business. Testing plan should be developed in accordance with a risk based methodology and delivered in line with group Sarbanes Oxley (SOX) and Financial Control guidelines
column2: as well as in joint consideration with Business facing Qualitative risk factors. Controls Assurance Sr Analyst supports The CTE Manager in ensuring the plan is managed and delivered in line with agreed timeframes adhering to SOX attestation requirement and the standard of testing is consistently of a high quality across all process and business and if sought external audit reliance is gained on any internal testing carried out. Controls Assurance Sr Analyst performs testing for controls design and operating effectiveness as Line of Defense 2 for Shell.

column1:
Description:

KPMG’s Global Transfer Pricing Services is a team of professionals dedicated to providing clients with effective transfer pricing planning
column2:
documentation and dispute resolution solutions. We assist clients in developing commercially and fiscally viable transfer pricing policies and our dedicated team of professionals is experienced in the Malaysian and OECD transfer pricing guidelines and associated requirements. We work closely with our clients to create and implement robust transfer pricing methodologies to meet their business goals and local tax authorities’ expectations.

Responsibilities:

  • Providing transfer pricing services to clients.
  • Assists management with building and maintaining relationships with tax authorities and clients.
  • Assists management with timely completion of projects.
  • Analyze financial and economic data for transfer pricing planning and tax audit defense.
  • Support management in the preparation of firms’ internal and external trainings and workshops.

Requirements :

  • A recognized university degree or a professional qualification in Economics / Accounting / Finance or a member of a recognized professional accounting/taxation body.
  • Minimum 2 - 3 years of relevant work experience.
  • Must be analytical

organized and able to multi-task and work independently.
  • Must be a team player to work in a robust team of multi-disciplinary professionals.
  • Must be able to assist in research to support project and practice development works

Support the continuous improvement projects as assigned by the Cash Application Team Lead
Adaptable to new ideas and ways of accomplishing tasks
Ability to work in a team environment
